title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@rstudio.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/ code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing
text: making substantial pull request, please file issue confirm problem @lydialucchesi. bugs, create issue illustrate minimal reproducible example.

title: Contributing
text: Create named branch (main). Limit scope pull request clearly defined improvement fix. restyle code unrelated pull request. Use roxygen2 documentation. user-facing changes, add bullet NEWS.md (current version header) change, GitHub username, links issues pull requests. Pull requests reviewed @lydialucchesi. either merge provide feedback. may add additional commits make minor edits (e.g., fixing typos) pull request merging .

title: Contributing
text: Please note smallsets project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: smallsets User Guide
text: vignette, explain use smallsets build Smallset Timelines. Smallset Timeline (Timeline) simple visualisation data preprocessing decisions. information Timelines can found Smallset Timeline paper YouTube. ACM FAccT paper Smallset Timelines 3-minute YouTube video 15-minute YouTube video

title: smallsets User Guide
text: vignette, use synthetic dataset s_data, included smallsets. contains 100 observations 8 variables (C1-C8). See ?s_data information.

title: smallsets User Guide
text: Run block code build Smallset Timeline. RStudio, figure appear plots pane.  Normally, pass character string code (e.g., “my_code.R” “/…/…/my_code.R”). However, script s_data_preprocess.R included smallsets example needs called system.file.
code: library(smallsets)  set.seed(145)  Smallset_Timeline(data = s_data,                    code = system.file("s_data_preprocess.R", package = "smallsets"))

title: smallsets User Guide
text: Smallset Timeline constructed dataset R/R Markdown/Python/Jupyter Notebook data preprocessing script. Scripts must contain series smallsets comments snapshot instructions. unprocessed dataset (data) commented preprocessing script (code) required inputs Smallset_Timeline. s_data_preprocess.R located working directory, code look like .

title: smallsets User Guide
text: smallsets package currently supports data preprocessing workflows fitting following description. dataset tabular class data.frame, data.table, tibble. Objects class data.table tibble immediately converted data.frame smallsets. preprocessing code contained one R, R Markdown, Python, Jupyter Notebook file. preprocessing code change row names original data object smallsets tracks rows names. Merges, joins, collapses, aggregations, switches wide/long format generally involve writing existing row names therefore generally currently supported smallsets. Renaming column results column deletion addition Smallset Timeline. preprocessing package dependencies loaded current R session. Information installing Python packages reticulate can found .

title: smallsets User Guide
text: make Smallset Timeline smallsets, need add structured comments snapshot instructions preprocessing script. smallsets comments follow formula. # smallsets snap + snap-place + name--data-object + caption[caption-text]caption Ex: # smallsets snap +4 mydata caption[removed rows implausible values.]caption following section includes example R preprocessing script smallsets structured comments.

title: smallsets User Guide
text: three options argument. Specify line code like snapshot taken , e.g., 17 means take snapshot 17th line code. Use plus sign number specify many lines code later take snapshot, e.g., +2 means take snapshot two lines code later. Don’t specify anything, snapshot taken directly structured comment (.e., next line code).

title: smallsets User Guide
text: name data object can change throughout script. snapshot taken object specified comment.

title: smallsets User Guide
text: snapshot caption describing preprocessing step.

title: smallsets User Guide
text: example R preprocessing script. demonstrates add smallsets structured comments preprocessing script. Based comment place arguments (empty, +2, +1), snapshots taken line 1, line 7, line 12. s_data_preprocess.R (Don’t run code block. ’s example preprocessing script.)
code: # smallsets snap s_data caption[Remove rows where C2 is FALSE.]caption s_data <- s_data[s_data$C2 == TRUE, ]  # smallsets snap +2 s_data caption[Replace missing values in C6 and C8 with # column means. Drop C7 because there are too many missing values.]caption s_data$C6[is.na(s_data$C6)] <- mean(s_data$C6, na.rm = TRUE) s_data$C8[is.na(s_data$C8)] <- mean(s_data$C8, na.rm = TRUE) s_data$C7 <- NULL  # smallsets snap +1 s_data caption[Create a new column, C9, by summing C3 and # C4.]caption s_data$C9 <- s_data$C3 + s_data$C4

title: smallsets User Guide
text: Alternatively, place smallsets comments block preprocessing code1, specify place argument line code like snapshot taken. comment set-produces Smallset Timeline comment set-R script . s_data_preprocess_block.R (Don’t run code block. ’s example preprocessing script.) 1 Note, though, preprocessing code Python functions comments must def return.
code: # smallsets snap 7 s_data caption[Remove rows where C2 is FALSE.]caption # smallsets snap 12 s_data caption[Replace missing values in C6 and C8 with # column means. Drop C7 because there are too many missing values.]caption # smallsets snap 16 s_data caption[Create a new column, C9, by summing C3 and # C4.]caption  # remove rows where C2 is false s_data <- s_data[s_data$C2 == TRUE,]  # deal with missing data s_data$C6[is.na(s_data$C6)] <- mean(s_data$C6, na.rm = TRUE) s_data$C8[is.na(s_data$C8)] <- mean(s_data$C8, na.rm = TRUE) s_data$C7 <- NULL  # create a new variable s_data$C9 <- s_data$C3 + s_data$C4

title: smallsets User Guide
text: Smallset Timelines can built preprocessing code R Markdown files. choose include Smallset Timeline figure within R Markdown report , works best build Smallset Timeline preprocessing code executed, don’t reload (un-preprocessed) data later build Smallset Timeline. assign Smallset Timeline figure object hide code echo=FALSE. can plot object anywhere report. see compiled R Markdown report, includes Smallset Timeline figure, run following code. write PDF titled s_data_preprocess.pdf working directory. example R Markdown file can viewed .
code: Smallset_Timeline(data = s_data,                    code = system.file("s_data_preprocess.Rmd", package = "smallsets")) rmarkdown::render(system.file("s_data_preprocess.Rmd", package = "smallsets"),                   output_dir = getwd())

title: smallsets User Guide
text: Python scripts can passed R command Smallset_Timeline. script s_data_preprocess.py, thing s_data_preprocess.R. smallsets commenting system Python. s_data_preprocess.py (Don’t run code block. ’s example preprocessing script.)
code: Smallset_Timeline(data = s_data,                    code = system.file("s_data_preprocess.py", package = "smallsets")) # smallsets snap s_data caption[Remove rows where C2 # is FALSE.]caption s_data = s_data[s_data["C2"] == True]  # smallsets snap 9 s_data caption[Replace missing values in C6 and # C8 with column means. Drop C7 because there are too many # missing values.]caption s_data["C6"].fillna(value = s_data["C6"].mean(), inplace = True) s_data["C8"].fillna(value = s_data["C8"].mean(), inplace = True) s_data = s_data.drop(columns = ["C7"])  # smallsets snap +1 s_data caption[Create a new column, # C9, by summing C3 and C4.]caption s_data["C9"] = s_data["C3"] + s_data["C4"]

title: smallsets User Guide
text: Jupyter Notebooks can passed R command Smallset_Timeline. example Jupyter Notebook can viewed .

what: Run smallsets in a Jupyter Notebook
title: smallsets User Guide
text: want execute smallsets Jupyter Notebook, can using Rmagic. starting Rmagic, run smallsets %%R magic cell.

title: smallsets User Guide
text: Smallset small set rows (5-15) original dataset containing instances data preprocessing changes. Smallset selection, two decisions make: 1) many rows (rowCount) 2) automated selection method use (rowSelect). rowSelect = NULL (default setting), rows selected simple random sample. following code randomly sample seven rows Smallset. use two selection methods, optimisation problems proposed (Section 5), need Gurobi license rely Gurobi solver v9.1.2 (free academic licenses available). Richard Schuster’s “Gurobi installation guide” prioritizr package provides step--step instructions installing Gurobi R. rowSelect = 1, coverage problem used select rows. snapshot, finds least one example data change, one. can return solution console rowReturn = TRUE. optimisation problem solved , solution can passed rowIDs avoid re-solve run Smallset_Timeline.  , coverage solution misses data edit example second snapshot, motivating use selection method (rowSelect = 2): coverage + variety optimisation problem, looks rows affected preprocessing steps differently. drawback rowSelect = 2 runtime large datasets. One potential workaround long runtime building Timeline sample dataset. However, done caution.
code: Smallset_Timeline(data = s_data,                    code = system.file("s_data_preprocess.R", package = "smallsets"),                    rowCount = 7, rowSelect = NULL) Smallset_Timeline(data = s_data,                    code = system.file("s_data_preprocess.R", package = "smallsets"),                    rowCount = 5, rowSelect = 1, rowReturn = TRUE) ## Smallset rows: "27", "42", "95", "96", "99" Smallset_Timeline(data = s_data,                    code = system.file("s_data_preprocess.R", package = "smallsets"),                    rowCount = 5, rowIDs = c("27", "42", "95", "96", "99")) Smallset_Timeline(data = s_data,                    code = system.file("s_data_preprocess.R", package = "smallsets"),                    rowSelect = 2, rowReturn = T) ## Smallset rows: "3", "32", "80", "97", "99"

title: smallsets User Guide
text: built-options customise Timeline. examples section highlight . See ?Smallset_Timeline full list options. Example 1 Differences: custom colour palette, data snapshots, highlighting missing data, ghost data, font, colour column names.  Example 2 Differences: vertical alignment, use second built-colour palette, colour column names.  Example 3 Differences: four snapshots, larger Smallset, use third built-colour palette, two rows, rotated column names, font.
code: set.seed(145)  Smallset_Timeline(   data = s_data,   code = system.file("s_data_preprocess.R", package = "smallsets"),   colours = list(added = "#FFC500",                  deleted = "#FF4040",                  edited = "#5BA2A6",                  unchanged = "#E6E3DF"),   printedData = TRUE,   truncateData = 4,   missingDataTints = TRUE,   ghostData = FALSE,   font = "Georgia",   sizing = sets_sizing(data = 2, captions = 3.5, columns = 3.5),   labelling = sets_labelling(labelCol = "darker", labelColDif = 1),   spacing = sets_spacing(captions = 3) ) set.seed(145)  Smallset_Timeline(   data = s_data,   code = system.file("s_data_preprocess.R", package = "smallsets"),   align = "vertical",   colours = 2,   spacing = sets_spacing(captions = 8, header = 2.5),   labelling = sets_labelling(labelColDif = 1),   sizing = sets_sizing(tiles = .4, captions = 3, columns = 3, legend = 12) ) set.seed(145)  Smallset_Timeline(   data = s_data,   code = system.file("s_data_preprocess_4.R", package = "smallsets"),   rowCount = 8,   colours = 3,   ghostData = TRUE,   missingDataTints = TRUE,   font = "serif",   spacing = sets_spacing(     captions = 3,     rows = 2,     degree = 60,     header = 1.5   ),   sizing = sets_sizing(     legend = 12,     captions = 4,     columns = 4     ) )

title: smallsets User Guide
text: can retrieve alternative text (alt text) Smallset Timeline. altText = TRUE, draft alt text printed console. can copied console, revised readability, included figure.
code: set.seed(145)  Smallset_Timeline(data = s_data,                    code = system.file("s_data_preprocess.R", package = "smallsets"),                    altText = TRUE) The Smallset Timeline, explaining how the dataset is preprocessed, consists of 3 Smallset snapshots. Data additions are mediumpurple2. Data deletions are lightgoldenrod2. Data edits are skyblue2. Unchanged data is gray89. Snapshot 1 is 5 rows by 8 columns. The columns, in order from left to right, are C1, C2, C3, C4, C5, C6, C7, and C8. 1 row is lightgoldenrod2. The caption says Remove rows where C2 is FALSE.. Snapshot 2 is 4 rows by 8 columns. Column C7 is lightgoldenrod2. 3 cells are skyblue2. The caption says Replace missing values in C6 and C8 with column means. Drop C7 because there are too many missing values.. Snapshot 3 is 4 rows by 8 columns. Column C9 is mediumpurple2. The caption says Create a new column, C9, by summing C3 and C4..

title: smallsets User Guide
text: resume marker vertical line snapshots signalling preprocessing stopped run analysis resumed facilitate new/revised analysis. added Timeline resume instruction structured comment. example, resume data preprocessing transform C9 categorical variable. s_data_preprocess_resume.R (Don’t run code block. ’s example preprocessing script.)
code: # smallsets snap s_data caption[Removed rows where C2 # is FALSE.]caption s_data <- s_data[s_data$C2 == TRUE,]  # smallsets snap 9 s_data caption[Replaced missing values in C6 and # C8 with column means. Dropped C7 because there are too many # missing values.]caption s_data$C6[is.na(s_data$C6)] <- mean(s_data$C6, na.rm = TRUE) s_data$C8[is.na(s_data$C8)] <- mean(s_data$C8, na.rm = TRUE) s_data$C7 <- NULL  # smallsets snap +1 s_data caption[Created a new column, # C9, by summing C3 and C4.]caption s_data$C9 <- s_data$C3 + s_data$C4  # smallsets resume caption[Ran the model but then  # decided to make another change to the dataset.]caption  # smallsets snap 27 s_data caption[Created a new categorical  # column, C10, based on C9 terciles.]caption t <- quantile(s_data$C9, c(0:3 / 3)) s_data$C10 = with(s_data, cut(   C9,   t,   include.lowest = T,   labels = c("Low", "Med", "High") )) set.seed(145)  Smallset_Timeline(data = s_data,                    code = system.file("s_data_preprocess_resume.R", package = "smallsets"),                    sizing = sets_sizing(                     columns = 1.8,                     captions = 1.8,                     legend = 7,                     icons = .8                     ),                   spacing = sets_spacing(                     captions = 3,                     degree = 45,                     header = 3.5,                     right = 2                     )                   )

title: Visual Documentation for Data Preprocessing
text: Smallset Timeline based R preprocessing script , s_data_preprocess.R. Structured comments added , informing smallsets .
code: # smallsets snap s_data caption[Remove rows where C2 is FALSE.]caption s_data <- s_data[s_data$C2 == TRUE,]  # smallsets snap +2 s_data caption[Replace missing values in C6 and C8 with  # column means. Drop C7 because there are too many missing values.]caption s_data$C6[is.na(s_data$C6)] <- mean(s_data$C6, na.rm = TRUE) s_data$C8[is.na(s_data$C8)] <- mean(s_data$C8, na.rm = TRUE) s_data$C7 <- NULL  # smallsets snap +1 s_data caption[Create a new column, C9, by summing C3 and # C4.]caption s_data$C9 <- s_data$C3 + s_data$C4

title: Smallset Timeline — Smallset_Timeline
text: Builds Smallset Timeline visualise data preprocessing   decisions.

title: Smallset Timeline — Smallset_Timeline
code: Smallset_Timeline(   data,   code,   rowCount = 5,   rowSelect = NULL,   rowReturn = FALSE,   rowIDs = NULL,   ignoreCols = NULL,   colours = 1,   printedData = FALSE,   truncateData = NULL,   ghostData = TRUE,   missingDataTints = FALSE,   align = "horizontal",   font = "sans",   sizing = sets_sizing(),   spacing = sets_spacing(),   labelling = sets_labelling(),   altText = FALSE )

title: Smallset Timeline — Smallset_Timeline
text: data Dataset preprocessed. code R, R Markdown, Python, Jupyter Notebook data preprocessing script. Include filename extension (e.g., "my_code.R", "my_code.Rmd", "my_code.py", "my_code.ipynb"). script working directory, include full file path. rowCount Integer 5-15 number Smallset rows. rowSelect NULL, 1, 2. NULL, Smallset rows randomly sampled. 1, Smallset rows selected using coverage optimisation model. 2, Smallset rows selected using coverage + variety optimisation model, long run time large datasets. Options 1 2 use Gurobi solver (v9.1.2) require Gurobi license. Please visit https://www.gurobi.com obtain license (free academic licenses available). rowReturn logical. TRUE prints, console, row numbers rows selected Smallset. rowIDs R preprocessing code, character vector row names  rows include Smallset. Python preprocessing code, numeric vector  indices rows include Smallset. ignoreCols Character vector column names indicating exclude Smallset Timeline. colours Either 1, 2, 3 one built-colour schemes (colourblind-friendly 2 works grey scale, .e., printer-friendly) list four hex colour codes added, deleted, edited, unchanged (e.g., list(added = "#5BA2A6", deleted = "#DDC492", edited = "#FFC500", unchanged = "#E6E3DF")). printedData logical. TRUE prints data values Smallset snapshots. truncateData Integer number characters printed data value. Results characters plus ellipsis. ghostData logical. TRUE includes empty tiles data removed. missingDataTints logical. TRUE plots lighter colour value missing data value. align Either "horizontal" "vertical". horizontal, snapshots plotted left right. vertical, snapshots plotted top bottom. font font installed R. sizing sets_sizing size specifications. spacing sets_spacing space specifications. labelling sets_labelling label specifications. altText logical. TRUE generates alternative text (alt text) Smallset Timeline prints console.

title: smallsets 2.0.0
text: December 2023 CRAN submission. New features updates: smallsets now builds Smallset Timelines preprocessing code R Markdown Jupyter Notebook files. Example Rmd ipynb files added package. format structured comments changed. longer start end instructions. Instead snapshot comments use snap instruction place argument well. change break existing smallsets code. Users can now ignore column dataset Smallset Timeline (.e., ignoreCols argument Smallset_Timeline() changed). Smallset Timelines can now vertically aligned, meaning snapshots plotted top bottom (instead left right) captions located right snapshots (instead ). new “align” argument Smallset_Timeline(). Smallset Timeline colour legend labels simplified. bug (introduced release R 4.2.0 changes .vector()) second optimisation Smallset selection problem fixed. documentation–including help pages, vignette, pkgdown website, README page–updated reflect package changes.

title: smallsets 1.0.0
